alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne County through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Jamestown to near Cabell to near Albany. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cabell, Susie and Zula around 735 PM EDT. Sunnybrook and Parnell around 740 PM EDT. Monticello, Powersburg and Hidalgo around 745 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Slickford, Mill Springs, Steubenville, Cooper, Burfield, Frazer, Oil Valley, Betsey, Gregory, Denney, Mount Pisgah, Coopersville, Kidder, Barrier, Rockeybranch, Delta, Kidds Crossing, Griffin, Parmleysville and Ritner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
